channel.title: We probably should address the scorned outing d1 play
channel.description:
I played for the weekend. I only have one question on my mind right now.
WHY ARE SCORNED CLAIMS LEFT ALONE?!? He frames, he decieves, he tricks invest classes. There's no use to BD now that the faction check is gone. So why?
Every single game I'm in.
And they leave the scorned alone.
Someone's framed.
Scorned outs day 1.
No action against the scorned.
What kind of fucked up meta do we have here?

item.title: We probably should address the scorned outing d1 play

item.description:
ah fuck, I can’t believe you done this

Read full topic

item.title: We probably should address the scorned outing d1 play
item.dc:creator: Soulshade55r
item.description:
While Investigative scorned was semi useful, let’s be honest a concirmable tber that can find evils is good for bd.

It doesn’t excuse the fact that scorned not can even do anything for bd apart from sit there and frame who in there right mind would even think that’s fun

item.title: We probably should address the scorned outing d1 play
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:

item.title: We probably should address the scorned outing d1 play
item.dc:creator: Twil1ight
item.description:
Superkran:

King just votes up a guy saying “vote up 5 he is unseen”, BD quickly vote him up without king’s finger and boom - prince gets force executed.

Why is it suppose to be Scorned’s fault? KEK

Superkran:

Following your logic, voting up people quickly is correct play because everyone does it.

What logic? That BD sometimes doesnt have their own mind and doesn’t think about consequences?
It’s a fact, kiddo.

Superkran:

The fact that majority of BD members do something doesn’t mean this is correct.

Quote it the sentence where i say that. Don’t twist my words, mister.

Superkran:

but for scorned I see none.

So???

It doesn’t change a fact that Scorned doesn’t have a restiction to always vote with BD. Complaining about backstabbing Neutrals and pretend it isn’t BD fault is dumb and naive.

Read full topic
item.source: We probably should address the scorned outing d1 play
